description: Alternative bypass methods configuration for obstacles when primary skills are unavailable

LockedDoor.description: Search nearby areas or negotiate with someone who has the key.
consequences: Social interaction may require favors or payment

flavorText.attempt: You begin methodically searching the area for a key or someone who might have one.
flavorText.success: Your thorough search pays off—you find the key hidden nearby.
flavorText.failure: Despite your efforts, no key can be found in the immediate area.

LockedDoor.description: Use raw strength to break down the door.
LockedDoor.checkDcNote: Varies by door type - see brute-force-options.json
consequences: Contents behind door may be damaged

flavorText.attempt: You brace yourself and prepare to force your way through.
flavorText.success: The door gives way under your assault.
flavorText.failure: The door holds firm against your strength.

LockedDoor.description: Manipulate the lock's runic bindings to release the mechanism.

flavorText.attempt: You focus your Rune Sight on the lock, perceiving the binding patterns within.
flavorText.success: The runic bindings unravel at your touch—the lock clicks open silently.
flavorText.failure: The runic patterns resist your manipulation. The binding holds.

LockedDoor.description: Find another path: ventilation shaft, window, or collapsed wall.
consequences: Alternate paths may have their own hazards
May not be accessible for all party members

flavorText.attempt: You scan the area for alternative entry points.
flavorText.success: You spot a ventilation shaft / window / structural weakness that bypasses the door entirely.
flavorText.failure: No viable alternate routes present themselves.

SecuredTerminal.description: Search for written passwords or credentials in the area.
consequences: Codes may be expired or single-use

flavorText.attempt: You search nearby desks, notes, and hidden compartments for written credentials.
flavorText.success: Success! Someone left their password on a sticky note. Typical.
flavorText.failure: No written credentials can be found nearby.

SecuredTerminal.description: Bypass this terminal by connecting to a less secured access point.
prerequisites: Secondary terminal must exist in area
consequences: Reduced access level (User instead of Admin)
May trigger ICE on secondary terminal

flavorText.attempt: You locate a secondary terminal and begin splicing a connection.
flavorText.success: The bypass connection establishes—you have limited but functional access.
flavorText.failure: The connection fails to establish. The terminals are incompatible.

SecuredTerminal.description: Stop at User Level access rather than pursuing Admin Level.
prerequisites: Must have achieved at least User Level access
consequences: Cannot access hidden or classified files
May need to return later with better access

flavorText.attempt: You decide that User Level access is sufficient for your current needs.
flavorText.success: You proceed with the limited access available to you.

ActiveTrap.description: Throw an object or use ranged attack to safely trigger the trap.
prerequisites: Object to throw or ranged weapon
Line of sight to trigger mechanism
consequences: Trap effects apply to area (may destroy loot)

flavorText.attempt: You ready a thrown object, aiming for the trap's trigger mechanism.
flavorText.success: Your throw is true—the trap activates harmlessly at a safe distance.
flavorText.failure: Your throw misses the trigger. The trap remains armed.

ActiveTrap.description: Attack the trap mechanism directly to disable it.
ActiveTrap.checkDcNote: Uses attack roll vs trap AC
consequences: Trap may trigger if not destroyed in one hit

flavorText.attempt: You ready your weapon and prepare to strike the trap mechanism.
flavorText.success: Your strike destroys the mechanism before it can activate.
flavorText.failure: Your attack fails to disable the mechanism—it triggers!

ActiveTrap.description: Block trap effect with shield or absorb with expendable item.
prerequisites: Item must be appropriate for trap type

flavorText.attempt: You interpose your shield/item between yourself and the trap.
flavorText.success: The trap triggers harmlessly against your protection—though at a cost.

None.description: No check required; automatic if prerequisites met

Might.description: MIGHT attribute check for physical force

Wits.description: WITS attribute check for clever solutions

Perception.description: Perception skill check for spotting alternatives

Runecraft.description: Runecraft skill check for runic manipulation

Attack.description: Standard attack roll vs target AC

PhysicalBarrier.description: Physical barriers like walls and rubble. Reserved for future versions.

EnergyBarrier.description: Energy fields and force barriers. Reserved for future versions.
